Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate Beto O'Rourke's actions by stating that he "voted to shield MS-13 gang members from deportation" without providing sufficient evidence or context.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that Beto O'Rourke voted to shield MS-13 gang members from deportation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Beto O'Rourke's vote on a proposal related to deporting or admitting criminal gang members automatically translates to voting to shield MS-13 gang members from deportation.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by an outside expert and O'Rourke himself, stating that his vote did not shield MS-13 members from deportation, as it happens regularly under current law.
